value: aava_1.0_score
description

The two metadata versions represent the same conceptual workflow with significant structural evolution. AAVA 2.0 introduces architectural changes while preserving core semantic meaning. Major structural reorganization affects backward compatibility.
Core workflow purpose and agent functionality remain semantically identical. Both versions describe DI DataMapping Recommender with same business logic and requirements.
Agent description content is identical between versions maintaining semantic consistency for business requirements.
Task instructions and output format requirements are preserved ensuring functional equivalence.
Root level structure changed from workflowId/workflowName to nested workFlowDetail object representing architectural evolution.
Nodes array renamed to workflowAgents array indicating conceptual shift from generic nodes to specific agent entities.
Agent structure flattened - task object eliminated with description moved directly to agent level.
Model field renamed from 'model' to 'modelDeploymentName' suggesting deployment-specific naming convention.
workflowId (numeric 5907) replaced by workFlowDetail.id (numeric 2096) - different identifier but same semantic purpose.
workflowName string replaced by workFlowDetail.name with slight formatting difference ('DI_DataMapping_Recommender' vs 'DI DataMapping Recommender').
agentName field removed in favor of name field at agent level - semantic equivalence maintained.
tools array replaced by toolReferences array - structural change with semantic preservation.
Model deployment reference changed from simple string 'gpt-4' to versioned string 'gpt-4.1' indicating version evolution.
Task object structure eliminated - expectedOutput field completely removed reducing metadata completeness.
expectedOutput field missing in AAVA 2.0 reduces specification completeness and governance quality.
Tools specification changed from explicit array ['FileWriterTool'] to empty toolReferences array reducing implementation clarity.
Workflow ID changed from 5907 to 2096 without clear migration mapping potentially breaking dependent systems.
Agent ID introduced (3900) in v2.0 without corresponding field in v1.0 creating new dependency.
Introduction of agentId field suggests evolution toward agent-centric architecture.
Nested workFlowDetail structure indicates move toward more structured workflow metadata.
Structural changes may break existing parsers expecting v1.0 node-based structure.
Missing expectedOutput specification may impact automated validation and testing frameworks.
Empty toolReferences array may indicate incomplete migration or loss of tool specification.
AAVA 1.0 JSON is syntactically valid with proper structure and no broken references.
All required fields are present and properly typed with consistent internal structure.
AAVA 2.0 JSON is syntactically valid with proper structure and no broken references.
New structure is internally consistent though some metadata completeness is reduced.
Both versions maintain identical core business logic and functional requirements ensuring migration feasibility.
Architectural evolution suggests movement toward more sophisticated workflow management system.
